alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles; Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 30 at 5:43AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Southern and central Los Angeles County. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 532 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to locally heavy rain over the advisory area. Rainfall rates up to 0.25 to 0.50 inches per hour are possible through the morning. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Morning travel on area roadways will be affected by ponding on pavement surfaces. Drive with caution, additional time may be needed to reach destinations. Minor mud and rockslides are possible on canyon roadways. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Long Beach, Malibu, Hollywood, Downtown Los Angeles, Burbank, Beverly Hills, Culver City, Inglewood, Pasadena, Van Nuys, Santa Monica, and the Fish and Bobcat Burn Scars. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
